name: Database and network design and administration
description: In the field of Information and Communication Technologies (ICTs), this involves the study of designing, maintaining, and integrating software applications, with a focus on databases and computer networks, including computer media applications.

name: Computer administration and management
description: Focuses on the overall management and operational administration of computer systems and networks within an organization.

name: Computer media applications
description: The study and use of software applications designed for creating, editing, and managing digital media content, relevant to database and network environments.

name: Computer network installation and maintenance
description: Covers the practical skills of setting up, configuring, and maintaining computer networks to ensure their proper functioning.

name: Database administrator studies
description: Specialized training for managing and maintaining database systems, including security, performance, and data integrity.

name: Information technology administration
description: Broader administrative roles within IT, encompassing the management of IT resources, including databases and networks.

name: Information technology security
description: Focuses on protecting information systems, databases, and networks from unauthorized access, use, disclosure, alteration, or destruction.

name: Network administration
description: The process of managing and maintaining an organization's computer network infrastructure to ensure connectivity and performance.

name: Network design
description: The planning and design of computer network infrastructures, including hardware, software, and communication protocols.

name: Web design
description: The process of planning, conceptualizing, and arranging content intended for the Internet, often involving aspects of database and network integration.
